III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In the period between July 2020 and May 2021, a staff member
used to pick up girls on home visits and would engage in sexual
contact with them. This staff member would come to work under
the influence of substances.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on 4/23/2025. Complainant
did not have any further information.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/25/25. Supervisor 1 reported she was employed with the facility
during the timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 1
denied having any recollection of a staff member picking up girls
and/or engaging in sexual contact with them, on or off campus.
Supervisor 1 denied any specific recollection of a staff member
coming into work under the influence of substances during this
time frame.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/21/25. Supervisor 2 reported she was employed with the facility
during the timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 2
denied recollection of rumors or awareness of any staff engaging
with any youth in sexual contact, on or off campus or picking them
up when they were not supposed to as part of their job. Supervisor
2 denied awareness of any staff coming into work while under the
influence of substances during the referenced time frame.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/28/2025. Supervisor reported being employed by the facility for
over six years and she was employed during the timeframe of July
2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 3 denied awareness of any
staff picking up youth on home visits and/or engaging in sexual
contact with them. Supervisor 3 denied awareness of staff coming
to work under the influence during that time frame.
Documentation review:
• Employee Behavior Policy 022-144 states reporting to work
under the influence of any substance that may impair the
ability to perform the job safely and effectively is prohibited.
Policy further states that failure to maintain professional
interpersonal relationships with clients and abuse, neglect,
or mismanagement of clients are also prohibited.
2

• Staff and Client Interaction Policy 022-406 states that staff
are prohibited from presenting themselves in a manner that
could be construed as sexual or flirtations in nature to
clients.
• Email authored by Consumer Right’s Officer of facility,
stating he did not find any incident reports from July 2020
through May 2021 regarding staff coming into work under
the influence of substances or staff picking up youth
outside of working hours or for non-work related tasks.
Email further states that there were no incident reports of
staff picking up youth on home visits and engaging in
sexual contact with youth during this timeframe.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted,
staff who were employed during the timeframe of July 2020-May
2021 denied any awareness of staff coming to work under the
influence or transporting youth while on home visits and engaging
in sexual contact with them. This is further supported through
email documentation the facility does not have any related
incident reports during that time frame.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

Type
Allegation A youth has gone AWOL, and the facility has not been

Investigation This allegation is being investigated under SI 2025SIC0000568.
Analysis This allegation is being investigated under SI 2025SIC0000568.

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
3

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
The Donna Maria building was utilized as a punishment space in
the timeframe of July 2020-May 2021.
Allegation 2:
In the timeframe of July 2020-May 2021, a staff grabbed a youth’s
ponytail and pulled the youth to the ground.
Investigation ALLEGATION 1:
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on 4/23/2025. Complainant
did not have any further information.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/25/25. Supervisor 1 reported she was employed with the facility
during the time frame of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor
1 reported that she worked in the identified building on occasion
during the time frame referenced. Supervisor 1 denied recollection
of any concerns about the building. Supervisor 1 denied that any
building on campus has been used as a “punishment” space while
she has been employed at the facility. Supervisor 1 denied
observing or awareness of any concerning behavioral
management practices occurring in the Donna Maria building.
Supervisor 1 reported the building is now closed however she was
not sure why it is no longer used.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/21/25. Supervisor 2 reported she was employed with the facility
during the timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 2
denied that Donna Maria was ever used as a punishment area.
Supervisor 2 denied awareness or observing any concerning
behavioral management practices occurring in the Donna Maria
building.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/28/2025. Supervisor 3 reported being employed by the facility
for over six years, and confirmed her employment during the
timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 3 denied
knowledge of the building being utilized as a punishment area for
youth. Supervisor 3 reported to her recollection the building is no
longer used due to contract changes; denying that it was closed
due to any concerns in the building or anything that went on there.
Documents reviewed:
• Behavioral Management Policy 005-010 states Vista Maria
strictly prohibits excessive or inappropriate use of behavior
4

management intervention. Behavior management
interventions will not be used as a form of discipline or to
force compliance, for the convenience of staff, or for
property damage that does not involve threatening danger
to self or others.
• Email authored by Quality Specialist states Donna Maria
was closed to reduce the residential treatment beds per
direction given from leadership following low census
numbers due to the pandemic.
• Email authored by Consumer Right’s Officer documenting
behavioral management incident reports during the time
frame of July 2020-May 2021: Email documents 5
behavioral management complaints which were confirmed
to be reported to and investigated by DCWL. None of the
documented complaints alleged that Donna Maria was
being used as a “punishment space.” Allegation related to
behavioral management in Donna Maria was documented
to be investigated in SI20210219045. A violation was not
established.
ALLEGATION 2:
This allegation was previously investigated under
SIR#2021C0219023 completed on 3/9/2021. The report reflected
a repeat rule violation for R400.4159 Resident Restraint.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance for allegation #1 as per
interviews conducted, and documentation reviewed, there is no
record of concerns related to the building being utilized for
punishment. Staff interviews consistently denied awareness of
concerns with behavioral management methods in the building.
Allegation #2 was previously investigated under
SIR#2021C0219023 completed on 3/9/2021. The report reflected
a repeat rule violation for R400.4159 Resident Restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & R 400.4431 Heating equipment.
Section (1) Heating equipment shall be capable of maintaining a
Description temperature of not less than 68 degrees Fahrenheit at a point 4
feet above the floor. An accurate thermometer shall be provided.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation This Donna Maria building did not have heat. A youth’s hands
turned blue from being cold in this building and the youth was not
given a blanket.
5

Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on 4/23/2025. Complainant
did not have any further information.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/25/25. Supervisor 1 reported she was employed with the facility
during the time frame of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor
1 reported that she worked in the identified building on occasion
during the time frame referenced. Supervisor 1 denied recollection
of any concerns about the building. Supervisor 1 denied there the
building was lacking heat and denied recollection of any youth
complaining of the cold or their hands turning blue from the cold,
or not being given a blanket.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/21/25. Supervisor 2 reported she was employed with the facility
during the timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 2
denied Donna Maria hall was lacking heat, that any youth’s hands
ever turned blue due to the cold, or recollection of a youth not
being given a blanket in the building. Supervisor 2 reported that
the building was sensitive to thermostat adjustments and would
quickly cool down or heat up so it was often adjusted when youth
would become cold or warm however it was promptly tended to
when youth became uncomfortable.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/28/2025. Supervisor reported being employed by the facility for
over six years and confirmed her employment during the
timeframe of July 2020 through May 2021. Supervisor 3 reported
recalling the Donna Maria building and denied hearing from any
youth or staff regarding there the building lacking heat. Supervisor
3 denied awareness of any youth not receiving blankets in the
building and denied awareness of a youth’s hands turning blue
from the cold.
Documents reviewed:
• Email authored by Consumer Right’s Officer states a
search was done in the system for incidents related to
youth complaining of cold temperature. No incident reports
related to cold temperature, youth not receiving a blanket,
or their hands turning blue from July 2020 through May
2021 in Donna Maria were found.
• Email authored by Quality Director confirmed during the
time frame from July 2020-May 2021, there is one facility’s
note related to the temperature in Donna Maria. The note
dated 8/10/2020 states there is no ventilation flowing to B
Wing, C Wing is very cold, and Room E is the hottest and
6

the youth is uncomfortable. The concerns were marked as
repaired on 8/12/2020.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted,
and documentation reviewed, there is no information to support
there were any incidences in which youths’ hands turned blue due
to cold, youth were not given a blanket, or the building lacked
heat.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
